Description: Painted pottery shabti of Djedkhons, a pure-priest of Amun, with a lappet-wig with a black fillet, a modelled face and crossed arms in relief holding two black hoes; the front of the remaining leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the lower leg section has broken away.
Condition: incomplete - lower leg section missing, paint worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
